While gold and silver saw significant gains, analysts warn against chasing euphoria. A balanced portfolio with a higher equity allocation is recommended for the coming year, considering market performance and risk appetite.

items.title: Gold lends most glitter to loans with 125% surge
items.summary: Gold loans have seen a remarkable surge, growing by 125 percent in a year. This boom is attributed to rising gold prices, making it a more valuable collateral. Banks have now overtaken NBFCs in the gold loan market share. Other loan segments like vehicle and personal loans also showed growth, while consumer durable loans contracted.

items.title: Devyani & Sapphire to merge, form QSR giant
items.summary: Devyani International and Sapphire Foods India are merging operations. This union will create India's largest quick-service restaurant entity. The combined company will operate over 3,000 stores. This significant consolidation aims to accelerate KFC's expansion and revitalize Pizza Hut. The merger is set to become effective from April 1.

At 2.25 p.m., the Sensex was up 495 points at 85,683, while the Nifty 50 advanced 162 points to 26,309.

The Nifty Bank index touched a fresh all-time high of 60,118.10 and was trading at 60,085.05 at noon, after opening at 59,757.40 compared with its previous close of 59,711.55.

This marks one of Apax's first pure-play consumer investments in India, aligning with the firm's focus on premiumisation trends.

Fuel sales also exceeded yearly averages, indicating a positive economic outlook.

Dedicated ecommerce export hubs will streamline logistics and customs processes.

items.title: Smoking will burn a bigger hole in your pocket now as govt imposes new excise duty on tobacco
items.summary: Cigarette prices in India are set to rise by up to 20% from February due to a sharp increase in excise duty, hitting premium large sticks the hardest. Entry-level cigarettes priced at ₹10-₹20 may disappear, affecting sales volumes for the next two to three quarters. The Tobacco Institute of India warned the hike would hurt over 40 million farmers, MSMEs, retailers, and local supply chains, while boosting illicit trade.

items.title: NHB flags PMAY 2.0 disbursal lag, urges housing finance companies to step up
items.summary: During a review meeting with chief executives of leading housing finance companies (HFCs) last week, the NHB chief said disbursements were "not up to the mark" and urged lenders to sharpen their focus on the programme, officials familiar with the discussions said.

items.title: Before EVs became political, there was the Toyota Prius
items.summary: Electric vehicles have moved beyond being seen simply as cars and have become caught in political and cultural debates, especially in the United States. Supporters view EVs as tools to fight climate change and boost industry competitiveness, while critics see them as symbols of government pressure and ideological overreach, a divide sharpened by Elon Musk’s public commentary.

items.title: Lending rates edge up to 8.7% as fresh loans get costlier

items.title: Arugn Tech gets MIB nod to buy AION Capital's stake in Planetcast Media
items.summary: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has approved Arugn Technologies’ proposal to acquire AION Capital’s stake in teleport operator Planetcast Media, paving the way for a change in ownership at the broadcast services firm. Arugn Technologies is a special purpose vehicle of Planetcast promoters Lallit Jain and Mahendra Nath Vyas.

items.title: Institutional capital, tighter norms rewrite Indian realty funding rules
items.summary: In India, the dynamics of real estate financing have taken a new turn. Funding has become more methodical, compelling developers to raise substantial equity before engaging in projects. The release of funds is tightly aligned with the achievement of defined project benchmarks, and banks are adopting a more discerning approach.

items.title: Jet fuel price cut by 7%; commercial LPG rate hiked by ₹111 per cylinder
items.summary: Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF) prices saw a 7.3% reduction, while commercial LPG rates increased by ₹111 per cylinder. These revisions align with global fuel benchmarks. The ATF price cut aims to ease pressure on airlines, which rely heavily on fuel costs, while domestic LPG prices remain unchanged.

items.title: GST collection climbs 6% on revenue from imports
items.summary: Gross revenue from domestic transactions rose 1.2% to over ₹1.22 lakh crore, official data published Thursday showed, while revenues from imported goods climbed about a fifth to ₹51,977 crore during December.

items.title: Petrol, diesel, LPG consumption show above average increase in December
items.summary: In December, fuel demand experienced an unprecedented upswing, eclipsing annual averages. Diesel saw a remarkable boost, complemented by notable increases in petrol and LPG use, highlighting a vibrant economic pulse.

items.title: MGNREGS work demand drops 28% in December after law change
items.summary: About 18.44 million people sought the typically unskilled work under the MGNREGS in December, down 28.4% from 25.77 million a year earlier. In November, however, only 14.66 million people had demanded work.

items.title: Deepinder Goyal on 10-minute delivery promise amid gig workers' strike: ‘No system is perfect, and we are…’
items.summary: Deepinder Goyal, on 1 January 2026, reacted to the 10-minute delivery promise amid the gig workers' strike on New Year's Eve, acknowledging that the system is not perfect, but it is different from what is being portrayed on social media. Here's what the executive said.

items.title: India's exports may reach $950 billion in FY27 on West Asia trade pacts
items.summary: India's export horizons are expanding rapidly, with projections hitting $840-850 billion in FY26 and climbing to $950 billion in FY27. The fostering of free trade agreements, particularly with nations in West Asia, alongside robust growth in sectors like services and electronics, are pivotal to this surge.

items.title: NFRA issues toolkit to help auditors detect errors in financial statements
items.summary: The National Financial Reporting Authority has issued a new toolkit to help small and medium accounting firms better assess risks of material misstatement in company audits, particularly at the revenue level. The regulator said the toolkit provides adaptable sample documents that can be tailored to different audit engagements.

items.title: Government plans next phase of skilling reforms with outcome-based approach
items.summary: The deliberations focused on outcome-based grading mechanisms for ITIs, strengthening Sector Skill Councils, and simplifying institutional systems

items.summary: Developed through integration of the Department of Fertilisers’ IFMS and the Finance Ministry’s PFMS, the system enables real-time tracking, centralised reporting and faster payments.

items.summary: The two Indian Yum! Brands franchisees of KFC and Pizza Hut to merge; Devyani to become leading QSR company

items.summary: The move follows a review of existing rules based on recommendations of a high-level reform panel and stakeholder feedback

items.summary: Banks ​will have to ⁠meet eligibility criteria linked to networth, market capitalisation, and prudential soundness, PFRDA added

items.title: Pernod Ricard India stays as largest alcoholic beverage firm with Rs 27,445.80 crore sales in FY25
items.summary: Pernod Ricard India has once again emerged as the country's top alcoholic beverage maker by value for FY25. The company's consolidated sales reached Rs 27,445.80 crore. This places it ahead of Diageo India, whose revenue from operations stood at Rs 27,276 crore. United Breweries Ltd followed with Rs 19,444.44 crore in consolidated income.

items.title: Govt relaxes KYC rules for company directors, allows easier voluntary closure of state-run firms
items.summary: The corporate affairs ministry has eased compliance norms for company directors by allowing them to file know-your-customer details once every three years instead of annually, with the change effective from March 31. Directors who have already completed their latest KYC will now need to file again only by June 30, 2028, while those who have not complied must reactivate their director identification numbers by March 31.

items.title: Flex offices are the new gateway for GCCs
items.summary: Flexible workspace operators are strategically partnering with Global Capability Centers (GCCs) to facilitate their expansion into India. GCCs require significant office space by 2030, with flex spaces poised to capture a substantial portion. These operators are offering comprehensive solutions beyond just desks, acting as extended operational teams to ensure speed-to-market and seamless execution for entering firms.

items.title: KFC operators Sapphire Foods-Devyani International's merger to create fast-food giant in India
items.summary: Sapphire Foods India said it will merge with Devyani International, a move expected to consolidate local franchise partners of Yum Brands, which owns KFC and Pizza Hut. The companies said the proposed merger is subject to approvals from regulators, stock exchanges, the Competition Commission of India, the National Company Law Tribunal, and shareholders and creditors.

items.title: RBI eases capital norms for NBFCs financing high-quality infrastructure projects
items.summary: The RBI said the Amendment Directions will be applicable from April 1, 2026, or from an earlier date when these directions are adopted by a NBFC in entirety

items.title: With an aim to boost NPS, regulator allows banks to set up own pension funds
items.summary: In a move that is set to widen distribution of pension products, the PFRDA board has given an in-principle nod to a framework that will permit scheduled commercial banks to set up their own pension funds under the National Pension System.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp sales surge 40% to 4,56,479 units in December
items.summary: Hero MotoCorp saw a significant 40 percent jump in wholesales for December 2025. The company sold 4,56,479 units compared to 3,24,906 units in December 2024. This growth was fueled by strong domestic demand, new product launches, and excellent performance in both its ICE and EV scooter segments. Motorcycle sales also saw a substantial rise, contributing to the overall positive results.

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?

This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.

items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Flipkart records highest-ever single day sale, grosses $200mn
items.summary: This is the biggest ever single day sale for Bangalore-based Flipkart, since the time the company started in 2007.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
